Deprecated API

Contents
  • Deprecated Methods
Deprecated Methods
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.attack(String, int, int, int[], String, String[], String)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.attack(int yourTownID, int enemyx, int enemyy, int[] auAmts, String attackType, String[] target,String name, boolean send) instead 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.build(String, int, String)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.build(String type, int lotNum, int tid) instead UI Implemented. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.buildCombatUnit(int, String, int, String)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.buildCombatUnit(String type, int number, int lotNum, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.buildCombatUnit(String, int, String)
          Automatically finds the largest building for your unit type in the town and builds the number of the unit type(military only) described in the town designed by townName if possible. NOTE THAT THIS METHOD IS EXTREMELY LAGGY. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.buildEng(int, int)
          This method has been commented out, it was not updated with the infrastructure switch. Use will result in return false. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.buildEng(int, String, int)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.buildEng(int lotNum, int number, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.buildEng(String, int)
          This method has been commented out, it was not updated with the infrastructure switch. Use will result in return false. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.buildSchol(String, int, int)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.buildSchol(int lotNum, int number, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.buildTrader(int, int)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.buildTrader(int lotNum, int number, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.buildTrader(String, int)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.buildTrader(int lotNum, int number, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.canBuild(String, int, String)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.canBuild(String type, int lotNum, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.canBuy(String, String, int)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.canBuy(String unitType, int number, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.canBuy(String, String, int, int)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.canBuy(String unitType, int number, int lotNum, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.cancelQueueItem(int, String)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.cancelQueueItem(int lotNum, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.cancelQueueItem(UUID, int, String)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.cancelQueueItem(UUID qid, int lotNum, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.canUpgrade(int, String)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.canUpgrade(int lotNum, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.demolish(int, String)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.demolish(int lotNum, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.getEngineerReductionsAsStringArray(int, int)
          THIS METHOD IS NO LONGER USED.

          Was to be used with the UI switcher that never got implemented.

BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.notifyViewer()
          method for the original, Java based, Battlehard Viewer. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.resupply(UUID, String, int[])
          Use BattlehardFunctions.resupply(UUID raidID, int[] auAmts, int yourTownID) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.returnPrice(String, int)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.returnPrice(int lotNum, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.returnPrice(String, String, int)
          Use BattlehardFunctions.returnPrice(String unitType, int number, int tid) instead. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.setVersion(String)
          Was to be used with the UI switcher that never got implemented. 
BattlehardFunctions.BattlehardFunctions.wait(int)
          Only used with older versions of the Revelations interface. Please migrate to Revelations 2.0 if you have not already done so.
